{"step_by_step_thinking": "The anatomic snuff box is a triangular deepening on the radial, dorsal aspect of the hand—at the level of the carpal bones, specifically, the scaphoid and trapezium bones forming the floor. The most common fracture that occurs from a fall on an outstretched hand is a scaphoid fracture, especially when there is pain in the anatomic snuff box.", "answer_choice": "D. Scaphoid fracture"}
